quizzes.explanation: The majority view (Hanafis, Maalikis, Shaafa'is) is that takbeers of movement and saying 'Rabb ighfir li' between prostrations are Sunnah acts of prayer, not obligatory. The Hanbalis held they are obligatory, but the majority view differs.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Takbeers of movement ruling

quizzes.questionText: According to the Quran, why did Allah create mankind and jinn?

options.text: To worship Him alone
To populate the earth
To compete with each other
To test the angels

quizzes.explanation: Allah says in Surah Adh-Dhariyat 51:56: 'And I (Allah) created not the jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me (Alone).' This means to believe in His Oneness and devote worship exclusively to Him, following the example of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).

sourceReference.questionTitle: Why God created mankind

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to mention that one has memorized the Quran to encourage others?

options.text: Yes, if done to encourage or serve people's interests
No, it must always be kept secret
Only to one's family members
Only in written form, not verbally

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to speak of blessings like Quran memorization if done to ward off harm or serve people's interests, such as encouraging them to memorize. This is not the forbidden type of self-praise. Prophet Yusuf said 'Set me over the storehouses...I will guard them with full knowledge.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Showing you are hafiz

quizzes.questionText: What makes an action bid'ah (innovation) in Islam?

options.text: Either introducing worship with no basis, or changing its manner/time/place
Only doing things the Prophet never did
Doing sunnah acts at different times
Any new action after the Prophet's time

quizzes.explanation: Bid'ah means either (i) real innovation: introducing worship with no basis in Islam, or (ii) relative innovation: doing a prescribed act in a different manner, time, place, or number than prescribed, making it specific when it was not specific.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Sunnah and bid'ah

quizzes.questionText: If a man promises to marry a woman, does he have any marital rights over her?

options.text: No, he has no marital rights
Yes, promises create marital rights
Only if witnessed by two people
Yes, if the promise was before Allah

quizzes.explanation: A mere promise to marry does not make someone a wife. She remains a non-mahram. Marriage requires a proper contract with proposal, acceptance, guardian's approval, and two witnesses. Saying 'you are my wife before Allah' does not constitute a valid marriage contract.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Promise to marry and marital rights

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a male bus driver to be alone with a single female passenger?

options.text: No, it is forbidden (haraam)
Yes, if it's for a short distance
Yes, if she is going to the mosque
Yes, if he is a professional driver

quizzes.explanation: It is forbidden for a driver to be alone with a non-mahram woman, regardless of the destination. To avoid this, there should be two female passengers who get on together first in the morning and two who get off together last in the afternoon.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Bus driver alone with woman

quizzes.questionText: What is one of the bad effects of sin on a person?

options.text: Deprivation of knowledge
Increased intelligence
Better memory
More blessings

quizzes.explanation: Sin has many bad effects including deprivation of knowledge, as knowledge is a light that Allah instills in the heart but sin extinguishes. Imam al-Shaafi'i was told by Imam Malik not to extinguish the light of knowledge with the darkness of sin.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Falling into sin and forgetting knowledge

quizzes.questionText: Can a young boy who has reached the age of discernment act as a mahram for travel?

options.text: According to the majority, yes if he is close to puberty
No, he must be an adult
Only for local travel, not long distance
Only if he is over 15 years old

quizzes.explanation: The Hanbalis stipulated the mahram must be an adult, but the majority of scholars hold that if the mahram is a boy who has reached the age of discernment and is close to puberty, and the woman feels safe with him, he may be her mahram for travel.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Who is mahram for travel

quizzes.questionText: Are a husband's nephews considered mahrams to his wife?

options.text: No, they are not mahrams
Yes, they are mahrams
Only the husband's brother's sons are mahrams
They become mahrams after 10 years

quizzes.explanation: The sons of a husband's brothers and sisters are not mahrams to his wife. She must observe hijab with them and should not shake hands with them. They are among the people concerning whom the Prophet warned when he said 'Beware of entering upon women.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Husband's nephews as mahrams

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman in mourning (iddah) going out to visit her children after her husband's death?

options.text: She must stay at home and may only go out for necessary purposes
She can visit her children freely without restrictions
She must stay at home for 40 days without any exceptions
She can go out during the day but not at night

quizzes.explanation: A woman whose husband has died must stay in her house during the iddah period (four months and ten days). However, she may go out for necessary purposes such as going to court, hospital, or the marketplace.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Woman in 'iddah following the death of her husband going out to visit her children

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to intentionally open an interest-based bank account to use the interest for paying taxes?

options.text: No, it is not permissible because riba is haram
Yes, if the taxes are mandatory and burdensome
Yes, but only for non-Muslims in Muslim countries
It is permissible if the interest amount is small

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to open an interest-based account in order to pay taxes with the interest, due to the general prohibition on riba. However, if someone already has interest from past dealings and wants to repent, they may use it to pay taxes to ward off wrongdoing.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Should he use bank interest to pay off taxes?

quizzes.questionText: Can a woman have intercourse with her husband after her menstrual bleeding stops if she does tayammum instead of ghusl?

options.text: Only if water is unavailable or she cannot use it due to illness or travel
Yes, tayammum is always sufficient for purification after menses
No, ghusl with water is always required regardless of circumstances
Yes, if the husband orders her to do tayammum

quizzes.explanation: Ghusl with water is required after menstruation if water is available and one can use it. Tayammum only replaces ghusl when water is not available or cannot be used due to illness or travel.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Woman having intercourse if she does tayammum after her menstrual bleeding stops

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to have a second wedding party (walimah) after some time has passed from the first one?

options.text: Yes, if there is a valid reason for doing so
No, the walimah can only be done once
Yes, but only within the first week of marriage
No, unless the marriage contract is renewed

quizzes.explanation: There is nothing wrong with having a second wedding party even after some time has passed, if there is a valid reason such as pleasing one's parents or accommodating family circumstances.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Doing a second wedding party for his parents' benefit

quizzes.questionText: Can a mother act as the guardian (wali) in her daughter's marriage contract?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: The mother cannot act as the guardian in marriage. The guardian must be a male relative from the father's side, such as the father, grandfather, brother, or paternal uncle in that order.

sourceReference.questionTitle: She wants to marry a man but her mother rejected him

quizzes.questionText: According to the correct scholarly view, can a married woman ask her husband for payment for breastfeeding their children?

options.text: No, but she is entitled to maintenance and clothing
Yes, she can demand separate payment in addition to maintenance
Yes, but only if she breastfeeds for more than one year
No payment is needed if she does it voluntarily

quizzes.explanation: The correct view is that a married woman is not entitled to separate payment for breastfeeding their children, as this is a duty and she is already entitled to maintenance. However, a divorced woman may ask for payment for breastfeeding.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Can the mother ask the father for payment in return for breastfeeding her children from him?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling if a husband wants to have intercourse with his wife while she is observing a voluntary fast?

options.text: She may break the fast, and it is better for her to respond to her husband
She must refuse and complete the voluntary fast
They both commit a sin if intercourse occurs
She can only break the fast if she did not seek his permission initially

quizzes.explanation: The one observing a voluntary fast has the choice to complete it or break it. If the husband requests intimacy, it is better for the wife to respond to him, as responding to the husband is obligatory while voluntary fasting is recommended.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He had intercourse with his wife when she was observing a voluntary fast

quizzes.questionText: According to the view of Imam Ahmad, is a marriage contract valid if done while the woman is pregnant from zina with the same man, before repentance?

options.text: No, the marriage contract is invalid
Yes, the marriage contract is valid
It is valid only if the pregnancy is in the first trimester
It becomes valid after the child is born

quizzes.explanation: According to Imam Ahmad's view, the marriage is invalid if done before repenting and before waiting to establish there is no pregnancy. However, some scholars like the Hanafis and Shafi'is consider it valid, making this a matter of scholarly difference.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He did the marriage contract with her when she was pregnant as a result of zina

quizzes.questionText: Is the presence of a guardian (wali) required for a valid misyaar marriage?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: The presence of a guardian is emphatically required for any valid marriage, including misyaar marriage. The Prophet said: 'There is no marriage except with a guardian.' Marriage without a guardian is invalid.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Stipulating the presence of a guardian (wali) in a misyaar marriage

quizzes.questionText: Should a Muslim man who converted from Hinduism try to prevent having children with his Christian wife?

options.text: No, he should not prevent having children
Yes, to avoid religious confusion for the children
Yes, until his wife converts to Islam
It depends on the agreement between the spouses

quizzes.explanation: He should not prevent having children because having many children is encouraged in Islam, and the wife may later embrace Islam. The husband must bring up any children in the right religion and proper manners, as this is his Islamic duty.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Should he try not to have children with his Christian wife?

quizzes.questionText: Where must a revocably divorced woman (first or second talaq) stay during her iddah?

options.text: She must stay in her husband's house
She should go to her father's house
She can stay wherever she wishes
She must stay at a relative's house

quizzes.explanation: A woman who has been revocably divorced must stay in her husband's house during the iddah period. It is haram for the husband to ask her to leave or for her to leave, as commanded by Allah in Surah al-Talaq.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Revocably divorced woman staying in her husband's house until her 'iddah is over

quizzes.questionText: If a wife does not pray at all, what should the husband do?

options.text: Tell her she must repent and pray, or he must leave her because not praying is kufr
Continue advising her gently but stay married to her
Report her to the Islamic authorities
Pray on her behalf to maintain the marriage

quizzes.explanation: If a wife does not pray at all, according to authentic hadiths, not praying is kufr. The husband must tell her to repent and pray regularly, or he must leave her because she is not Muslim. Marriage to a non-Muslim is not permissible.

sourceReference.questionTitle: His wife does not pray regularly

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a wife to take money from her husband's wealth without his permission to spend on their son's marriage expenses?

options.text: Generally no, except if he is miserly toward obligatory maintenance
Yes, if it is for the children's benefit
Yes, because the money is shared family property
Yes, but she must tell him within one month

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible for a woman to spend her husband's wealth without his permission, unless he is stingy toward her and the children regarding obligatory maintenance. In such cases, she may take what is sufficient on a reasonable basis.

sourceReference.questionTitle: She took some of her husband's money without his knowledge to spend on her son's marriage

quizzes.questionText: According to the majority of scholars, does divorce issued in extreme anger count as divorce?

options.text: No, if the anger was so extreme he did not know what he was saying
Yes, divorce in anger always counts
Yes, unless he was physically restrained
No, anger always invalidates divorce

quizzes.explanation: If the anger reached a level where the person did not know what he was saying, or it was extreme anger that compelled him to divorce, then it does not count as divorce. However, ordinary anger does not prevent divorce from taking effect.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Divorce (talaaq) in the state of anger

quizzes.questionText: A woman's husband died and told her never to remove her gold bangles. During her iddah, what should she do?

options.text: Remove the bangles during iddah, as Islamic law takes precedence over his request
Keep wearing them as it was his final wish
Wear them under gloves so they are hidden
Wait until after iddah to decide

quizzes.explanation: A husband's request that contradicts Islamic law should not be followed. Women in iddah after their husband's death are forbidden from wearing jewelry. Islamic law takes precedence, and there is no obedience to anyone if it involves disobedience to Allah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Her husband told her that she should not take off her gold bangles

quizzes.questionText: If one spouse becomes Muslim but the other does not (and is not from the People of the Book), what happens to their marriage?

options.text: The marriage becomes invalid immediately
The marriage remains valid for one year
They must separate but can remarry later
The marriage is valid if they have children

quizzes.explanation: When one spouse becomes Muslim and the other does not (and is not from the People of the Book), the marriage contract immediately becomes null and void. It is not permissible for a Muslim to remain married to a mushrik (polytheist), as stated in the Quran.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He has become Muslim but his wife has not

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a wife to wash her deceased husband's body (ghusl al-mayyit)?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible for a wife to wash her deceased husband, and for a husband to wash his deceased wife, if they know how to do it properly. This is proven from the actions of the Companions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: It is permissible for one of the spouses to wash the other after death

quizzes.questionText: If a man wants to marry a religiously-committed woman but his father objects without a valid Islamic reason, what should he do?

options.text: He may marry her even without his father's approval
He must obey his father and not marry her
He should wait until his father passes away
He must seek permission from a judge first

quizzes.explanation: If the father prevents marriage to a suitable woman without a legitimate Islamic reason, and the son cannot be patient, he may marry her. It is not permissible for the father to prevent this marriage without valid cause. The father should give permission unless he has a legitimate reason he can explain.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Should he get married without his father's approval?

quizzes.questionText: If a person waives a financial right, can he later demand it back?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: Once a person waives a right over someone, that right is gone and cannot be demanded back. When something is waived, it cannot be taken back, as stated in Islamic legal principles. Taking back a gift is compared to a dog returning to its vomit.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He waived a financial right; can he renege on that waiving?

quizzes.questionText: Can a woman stipulate in the marriage contract that her husband will not take a second wife?

options.text: Yes, and if he breaks it she has the right to annul the marriage
No, such conditions are invalid in Islam
Yes, but the condition is not binding on the husband
No, it contradicts the Quran's permission for polygyny

quizzes.explanation: According to the view of Imam Ahmad and other scholars, a woman may stipulate this condition and it is valid. If the husband breaks it, she has the right to annul the marriage. The husband is voluntarily giving up his right, which is permissible.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Types of conditions in the marriage contract

quizzes.questionText: Is the hadith "eating and drinking are two 'awrahs, so cover them" authentic?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: This hadith has no basis in Islamic sources. The meaning it indicates is also incorrect, as eating and drinking are not among the 'awrahs that must be covered. The Prophet used to eat with his Companions openly.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Hadeeth which has no basis about eating and drinking being two 'awrahs

quizzes.questionText: If someone intends Qiraan (Hajj and Umrah together) at the meeqat but later changes to Ifraad (Hajj only) after entering ihram, what is the ruling?

options.text: The change is invalid; he must continue with Qiraan and offer hadiy
The change is valid and he is performing Ifraad
He must exit ihram and re-enter with the new intention
He must perform Umrah first, then Hajj separately

quizzes.explanation: If the change in intention happened after entering ihram, the ruling of Qiraan was not waived. His actions of Umrah are included with his Hajj actions, and he must offer the hadiy (sacrifice) of tamattu'.

sourceReference.questionTitle: It is not permissible to change the intention of ihraam from Qiraan to Ifraad

quizzes.questionText: In 'Aqd al-Istisnaa' (contract to have something made), is it permissible to delay paying the full price or pay in installments?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: In 'Aqd al-Istisnaa', it is permissible to delay paying the full price, or it may be paid in installments at specific times over a limited period, provided the contract meets the required conditions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: 'Aqd al-Istisnaa' (contract to have something made or done)

quizzes.questionText: After a woman's father dies, can her paternal uncles prevent her from marrying someone she wants to marry if he is religiously suitable?

options.text: No, guardianship should pass to the next closest wali who should allow the marriage
Yes, the paternal uncles have absolute authority
Yes, if they have valid concerns about the man
She can marry without any wali in this situation

quizzes.explanation: The wali does not have the right to prevent marriage without an acceptable Islamic reason. If he prevents her unjustly, guardianship passes to the next closest relative, then to the Islamic judge or one acting in his stead.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Her father engaged her to him, then her father died and her paternal uncles want to change the agreement

quizzes.questionText: If a marriage is done according to Islamic law but not registered with the state, is it valid?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: If marriage is done according to the law of Allah and His Messenger, it does not matter if man-made laws disagree. The marriage is legitimate and halal according to Islamic law, regardless of state registration.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Marriage according to sharee'ah but not the law of the land

quizzes.questionText: What is the most correct interpretation of the hadith "The best of you is the one who learns the Quran and teaches it"?

options.text: It encourages learning to read and teach the Quran
It refers only to memorizing the Quran
It applies only to professional Quran teachers
It means listening to Quran recitation frequently

quizzes.explanation: This authentic hadith narrated by al-Bukhari encourages learning to read the Quran and teaching it to others. The first revelation to the Prophet commanded 'Read!', emphasizing the importance of reading and writing, which began with learning the Quran.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He is asking about a hadeeth which encourages learning to read

quizzes.questionText: If a man signs a divorce document but does not utter or write the word of divorce himself and did not intend it, does divorce occur?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: According to the majority of scholars, if a man signs a divorce document written by someone else without intending divorce, then divorce has not taken place. Writing is subject to interpretation, and intention is crucial for divorce to occur.

sourceReference.questionTitle: He issued a divorce document when he does not really want to divorce

quizzes.questionText: What should a wife do if her husband is not satisfying her sexual needs?

options.text: Speak frankly with her husband about the matter
Continue pretending and never tell him
Refuse to fulfill his needs until he fulfills hers
Seek a divorce immediately

quizzes.explanation: The solution is speaking frankly with the husband. Often the problem stems from the husband not being aware there is an issue. Speaking openly is preferable to suffering silently, and the problem can usually be solved easily through communication.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Her husband is not satisfying her sexual desire

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to work in the production and design department of newspapers that contain forbidden content?

options.text: No, unless one can reduce evil and pave the way for righteous content
Yes, as long as you do not write the forbidden content yourself
Yes, if there are few job opportunities available
Yes, if you donate part of your salary to charity

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to work in newspapers containing forbidden things like indecent pictures, horoscopes, or articles against Islam, as this is cooperating in sin. An exception is if one can reduce evil and defend Islam. Otherwise, one should fear Allah and leave such work.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on working for newspapers

quizzes.questionText: Is a marriage contract valid if done without the approval of the woman's guardian (wali)?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: Marriage without the approval of the guardian is invalid according to the majority of scholars. The Prophet said: 'There is no marriage except with a wali.' The contract must be renewed in the presence of the guardian to be valid.

sourceReference.questionTitle: They were in a haraam relationship then they repented and got married without a wali

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a couple to engage in a physical relationship before marriage if they intend to marry later?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: This is absolutely not permissible. No legitimate relationship can exist until after the completion of a legal marriage contract (nikah) according to Islamic law. Claiming future marriage intentions does not make premarital physical relationships halal.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Premarital sex, and is it the parents' obligation to arrange marriage

quizzes.questionText: When should airplane passengers enter ihram for Hajj or Umrah?

options.text: When the plane comes in line with the meeqat, or slightly before to be safe
When boarding the plane at the departure airport
When arriving at Jeddah airport
One hour before landing in Saudi Arabia

quizzes.explanation: Airplane passengers must enter ihram when the plane comes in line with their meeqat. Since planes pass the meeqat quickly, it is recommended to enter ihram slightly before reaching it to be on the safe side and avoid passing it without being in ihram.

sourceReference.questionTitle: When should airplane passengers enter ihraam?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to earn money by making or copying images of animate beings for customers?

options.text: No, except for necessary purposes like ID photos or tracking criminals
Yes, if the customers are non-Muslims
Yes, as long as you are just copying, not creating
Yes, if you donate part of the earnings to charity

quizzes.explanation: Making images of animate beings is haram and earnings from it are haram, except for necessary purposes like ID photos or tracking criminals. One should work only with images of non-animate things or seek other employment.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Earnings of one who makes images

quizzes.questionText: According to the Islamic Fiqh Council, is it permissible to issue non-covered credit cards if no interest is charged?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to issue non-covered credit cards if there is no condition of paying interest on the original loan. The issuer may charge set fees to cover actual services, and commissions are permissible under certain conditions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Statement of the Fiqh Council on credit cards

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use a credit card that stipulates a penalty for late payment, even if you are confident you will pay on time?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to agree to or enter into a contract that includes a riba-based condition, even if one is confident of paying on time. It is haram to approve of riba or commit oneself to it under any circumstances.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Using a credit card from a British bank when travelling abroad

quizzes.questionText: If commercial insurance is compulsory for an individual but optional for their family, is it permissible to buy it for the family?

options.text: No, if it is commercial insurance involving gambling
Yes, because it saves money for the family
Yes, if the family members are dependents
Yes, as long as the individual insurance is already purchased

quizzes.explanation: If insurance is compulsory and cannot be avoided, the one forced to buy it is excused. However, if it is not compulsory (optional), it is not permissible to buy commercial insurance as it is a form of gambling which is forbidden.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on buying insurance that is compulsory for the individual

quizzes.questionText: Can a father sell some of his property to one of his sons who is able to purchase it?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible for a father to sell property to one of his sons if the son is able to purchase it. The father should deal with him as he would with a stranger, without giving preferential treatment that would favor him over his siblings.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Father selling some of his possessions to one of his sons

quizzes.questionText: Is it forbidden to use unperfumed toothpaste, cream, or lotion during ihram for Hajj?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: If these items are free of perfume, it is not forbidden to use them during ihram. What is forbidden in ihram is perfume or using anything that contains perfume.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Using unperfumed creams during ihraam

quizzes.questionText: If a woman did Hajj before she became religiously committed and wore proper hijab, does she need to repeat her Hajj?

options.text: No, unless she was not praying at that time
Yes, she must repeat it now that she is committed
No, but she should perform a voluntary Hajj
Yes, because she was not wearing proper hijab

quizzes.explanation: The Hajj performed before is sufficient and counts as the obligatory Hajj, even if she was falling short in religious commitment. However, if she was not praying at all during that time, her Hajj does not count because not praying constitutes kufr.

sourceReference.questionTitle: She did Hajj before she became religiously committed

quizzes.questionText: Can a man with slight sexual difficulties still get married?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: If a man has any sexual desire, even if little, he may get married. It is sufficient to be able to have intercourse even if only once every month or two. However, complete inability should be disclosed to the woman's guardian before marriage.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Is it permissible for a man who is suffering from some sexual difficulties to get married?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use a credit card that allows withdrawing money with a commitment to pay interest if payment is not made within a set time?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: This transaction is haram because it involves a commitment to pay riba if one does not pay within a certain time. This commitment is invalid even if one believes they will pay on time, because future circumstances are unknown and one may be unable to fulfill the commitment.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Using credit cards to withdraw money

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic view of the poetry collection 'al-Rubaiyat' attributed to Umar al-Khayyam?

options.text: It contains clear statements of kufr, promiscuity, and rejection of Islamic values
It is a valuable work of Islamic philosophy and poetry
It contains wisdom that Muslims should study
It is permissible to read for entertainment purposes only

quizzes.explanation: Al-Rubaiyat contains clear statements of kufr, promotes wine drinking, denies resurrection, encourages immorality, and mocks Islamic obligations. It contains no indication that its author believed in Allah and the Last Day, making it harmful content.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Who was 'Umar al-Khayyaam?

quizzes.questionText: If someone's parents committed benefit fraud with government money and the child consumed some of it unknowingly, does the child have to pay it back?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: The child does not have to pay back the money. The burden of sin applies to those who committed the fraud. The child should avoid taking any more of this money and should advise the parents to stop, but has no obligation to repay what was consumed during childhood.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Her mother deceived the state and got accommodation and benefits

quizzes.questionText: Is yellowish or brownish discharge that comes during the nifas period considered part of nifas?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yellowish and brownish discharge, so long as it is connected to nifas (within 40 days of giving birth), is part of it. The woman does not have to pray during that period. However, such discharge after seeing the sign of purity (tuhr) is not considered nifas.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Blood of nifaas returning on the fortieth day

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a husband to force his wife to give up her mahr or rights before divorcing her?

options.text: No, unless she has committed open illegal sexual intercourse
Yes, if he wants to divorce her
Yes, if she agrees to it willingly under pressure
Yes, if he is experiencing financial difficulty

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible for a husband to take anything of his wife's wealth or to treat her harshly to make her give up her mahr, except if she has committed a blatant act of immorality. The Quran explicitly forbids this practice.

sourceReference.questionTitle: It is not permissible to force one's wife to give up her rights before divorcing her

quizzes.questionText: How should a bedridden patient with a catheter perform wudoo and prayer?

options.text: Do wudoo at the time of each prayer and pray according to ability, ignoring what comes out after
Do wudoo once a day and pray all prayers with that wudoo
Delay prayers until able to do proper wudoo
Do tayammum instead of wudoo for all prayers

quizzes.explanation: A patient with a catheter should pray according to his situation, like one who is incontinent. He should do wudoo (or tayammum if unable) when the prayer time begins, then pray regardless of what comes out during the prayer, as this is similar to istihaadah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: How can a patient who has a catheter do wudoo' and pray?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to get a riba-based credit card to avoid a few days' delay in receiving one's salary?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: A few days' delay in receiving salary is not regarded as a necessity that would make it permissible to deal with a riba-based credit card. Signing an agreement to riba and committing to it is haram and not permissible for such a minor inconvenience.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on taking out a riba-based credit card

quizzes.questionText: Should those who have already performed the obligatory Hajj refrain from going again to let others have the chance?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: This is not correct. The texts point to the virtue of repeated Hajj and Umrah. The Prophet said they erase poverty and sin. A wise person can perform Hajj repeatedly while being kind to others and dealing with crowded conditions appropriately.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Some people say that those who have already done Hajj should let others have the chance

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to increase the price of a product when selling it in installments?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: According to the majority of scholars including the four imams, it is permissible to increase the price in return for delaying payment. This is different from riba because both parties benefit: the seller gets a higher price for the delay, and the buyer gets time to pay.

sourceReference.questionTitle: It is permissible to raise the price of a product in return for paying in installments

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on working on computer programs for a supermarket that sells alcohol?

options.text: It is permissible if you avoid anything directly related to alcohol
It is completely forbidden under all circumstances
It is permissible as long as you only work with food products
It is permissible if the company is based in a non-Muslim country

quizzes.explanation: If you can work while avoiding anything directly related to alcohol so that others handle those matters, there is nothing wrong with it. Recording or processing information about alcohol is helping with what is haraam, which is forbidden according to the Prophet's hadith cursing all those involved with alcohol.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Working on program for supermarket selling alcohol

quizzes.questionText: Did the Prophet (peace be upon him) ever hit his wife Aisha violently?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet never hit his wife violently. What occurred was a gentle shove or poke in the chest as a teaching gesture, not hitting to cause pain. This demonstrates the Prophet's perfect character and compassion toward his wives.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Did the Prophet hit Aisha

quizzes.questionText: If someone prays Witr at the beginning of the night, then wakes up for qiyam al-layl, what should they do?

options.text: Pray two by two without repeating Witr
Pray Witr again to make it the last prayer of the night
Pray one rak'ah only to make the total odd
Not pray at all since Witr was already performed

quizzes.explanation: If someone prays Witr then wakes up to pray qiyam al-layl, they should pray two by two without repeating Witr, as the Prophet said 'There cannot be two Witrs in one night.' The command to make Witr the last prayer is mustahabb, not obligatory.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Praying Witr twice in one night

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for prisoners to pray Jumu'ah in their cells while following the imam via loudspeaker?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: The Committee of Senior Scholars ruled that prisoners cannot pray Jumu'ah via loudspeaker in their cells because they are not obliged to pray Jumu'ah if they cannot physically attend. They should pray Zuhr instead unless they can attend the prison mosque.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Prisoners praying Jumu'ah in cells

quizzes.questionText: What should be done with leftover donations collected for a specific purpose?

options.text: Ask donors' permission or spend on the closest similar cause
Use it for any permissible purpose without asking
Return all excess money to the donors
Keep it for future projects of any kind

quizzes.explanation: You must ask donors' permission to use excess donations differently. If you cannot contact them, spend it on the closest cause to the original purpose. For example, if collecting for a mosque, extra funds should go toward another mosque, not unrelated causes.

sourceReference.questionTitle: What to do with leftover donations

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to hang chains with blue beads as decoration without believing they ward off evil?

options.text: It is permissible but better not to do it
It is completely forbidden under all circumstances
It is permissible with no reservations
It is only permissible if you recite Quran near them

quizzes.explanation: While technically permissible for adornment without false beliefs, it is better not to hang such beads because most people use them to ward off evil eye. This may cause others to think badly of you or imitate you incorrectly.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Hanging chains with blue beads

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on eating meat when the slaughterers are a mixture of Muslims, Christians, and idol-worshippers, and you cannot tell who slaughtered what?

options.text: It is haraam because of the mixture and uncertainty
It is halal based on the principle of doubt
It is halal if you say Bismillah before eating
It is halal as long as Muslims are part of the mixture

quizzes.explanation: When slaughterers are mixed and you cannot determine who slaughtered what, it is haraam because the basic principle is that meat is forbidden unless properly slaughtered. If you can determine who slaughtered what, you may eat meat from Muslims or Christians if done properly.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Meat from mixed slaughterers

quizzes.questionText: What should Muslim students' unions in non-Islamic countries do regarding moon sighting for Ramadan?

options.text: Take the place of Islamic government and inform all Muslims of their decision
Always follow Saudi Arabia's moon sighting
Let each Muslim decide individually based on their city
Use astronomical calculations only

quizzes.explanation: The Standing Committee ruled that Muslim students' unions should take the place of Islamic government in confirming the new moon for Muslims in non-Islamic countries. They should choose whether differences in moonrise times matter, inform all Muslims, and everyone should follow their decision to unite the community.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Moon sighting for Muslims in the West

quizzes.questionText: How many conditions must worship meet to be in accordance with sharee'ah?

options.text: Six conditions: reason, type, amount, manner, time, and place
Three conditions: sincerity, following Sunnah, and correct intention
Four conditions: time, place, manner, and amount
Five conditions: reason, type, time, place, and witnesses

quizzes.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, worship must be in accordance with sharee'ah in six aspects: reason (basis in sharee'ah), type (nature of the act), amount (number/quantity), manner (how it's done), time (when it's done), and place (where it's done).

sourceReference.questionTitle: Conditions of worship in Islam

quizzes.questionText: If medicine is harming you, is refusing to take it considered disobedience to your father?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: If medicine is proven harmful, refusing to take it is not disobedience to your father because obedience is only required in that which is good and proper. The Prophet said there should be neither harming nor reciprocating harm, and you should consult doctors to weigh the benefits and harms.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Refusing harmful medicine and disobeying father

quizzes.questionText: If the electrical current was cut off during the adhaan and then restored, should the muezzin repeat it using loudspeaker?

options.text: Not necessary if nearby mosques gave adhaan and people heard it
Yes, always repeat it with the loudspeaker
No, never repeat the adhaan once given
Only repeat if it's Friday prayer

quizzes.explanation: If people heard the adhaan from nearby mosques, repetition is not necessary as the purpose has been achieved. However, if it's the only mosque and no one heard the adhaan due to widespread power loss, it should be repeated so people know the time for prayer has come.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Repeating adhaan after electrical current restored

quizzes.questionText: In a small prayer room, is it acceptable for men to pray behind women in the same congregation?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, you must keep women separate from men even in small spaces. The back of the room should be designated only for women, with a barrier or marker if needed. Men who come late should stand behind other men and in front of the women's area.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Men praying behind women due to small room

quizzes.questionText: If you fast according to moon sighting in another country, but your own country confirms sighting later, what should you do?

options.text: Follow your country's sighting and start/end fasting with them
Continue following the other country
Make up the day you fasted early
Choose whichever sighting was earlier

quizzes.explanation: You must follow the scholars of your own country, as the Prophet said 'The fast is the day when you fast.' The Muslim should not differ from his country in starting and ending the fast, and you are not required to make up the fast if you follow your country.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Following local moon sighting vs other countries

quizzes.questionText: If you have 5000 pounds and one and a half years have passed, what is the zakaah due on it?

options.text: 125 pounds (2.5%)
250 pounds (5%)
500 pounds (10%)
187.5 pounds (3.75% for 1.5 years)

quizzes.explanation: Zakaah is 2.5% of wealth when a full hijri year has passed, which equals 125 pounds on 5000 pounds. The fact that additional time has passed (half a year) does not increase the rate - zakaah is still 2.5% annually, and it must be paid immediately when due.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Zakaah calculation and family fund

quizzes.questionText: When praying in congregation, which side of the row is better?

options.text: The right side if both sides are equal or similar
The left side is always better
The middle is always best regardless of position
It makes no difference at all

quizzes.explanation: The right side of the row is better than the left if both sides are equal or similar. However, if the right side stretches much further, then being on the left and closer to the imam is better. The imam should be in the middle or thereabouts.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Right vs left side of prayer row

quizzes.questionText: If a man and woman had a haraam relationship before marriage but are uncertain if penetration occurred, is their marriage valid?

options.text: Yes, if no penetration occurred or if they repented before marriage
No, the marriage must be annulled in all cases
Yes, but only if they wait five years
No, unless they divorce and remarry with a new contract

quizzes.explanation: If no zina (penetration) took place, or if it did but they repented before marriage, the marriage is valid. However, if penetration occurred without repentance, or if she didn't have a menstrual period before marriage, the contract should be annulled and redone after proper repentance and waiting.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Effects of marriage after illicit relationship

quizzes.questionText: If a woman willingly has intercourse with her husband during the day in Ramadan, what must she do?

options.text: Make up that day and offer expiation (kaffarah)
Only make up that day without expiation
Only the man must offer expiation, not the woman
Her fast remains valid if she was unaware of the ruling

quizzes.explanation: The majority of scholars say a woman who willingly has intercourse during Ramadan's day must make up that day and offer expiation, just like the man. If she was forced, ignorant, or forgot, then she doesn't have to do anything and her fast remains valid.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Expiation for woman having intercourse in Ramadan

quizzes.questionText: When entering the mosque while adhaan is being called, should you first repeat after the muezzin or pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid?

options.text: First repeat after the muezzin, then pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid
Pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid immediately regardless
Wait until after adhaan to pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid
Skip Tahiyyat al-Masjid if adhaan is being called

quizzes.explanation: It is preferable to repeat after the muezzin, then make du'a after adhaan, then pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid. However, on Friday during the second adhaan, some scholars allow praying Tahiyyat al-Masjid first since listening to the khutbah is obligatory while repeating is not.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Repeat muezzin or pray Tahiyyat al-Masjid

quizzes.questionText: If a father died owing two days of Ramadan from illness, should his children fast or feed the poor on his behalf?

options.text: Either fast on his behalf or feed poor persons - both are acceptable
Only fasting is acceptable, not feeding
Only feeding poor is acceptable, not fasting
Nothing is required since he was sick

quizzes.explanation: If the father was able to make up the days but was negligent, it is better if one of the children fasts on his behalf, or they can feed the poor (approximately 3 kg per day). However, if he was unable to make them up due to illness until he died, nothing is required.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Father died owing Ramadan fasts

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on someone who doubts the resurrection after death?

options.text: It is kufr that puts one beyond the pale of Islam
It is a minor sin that requires repentance
It is acceptable for elderly people due to their age
It is permissible if the person is illiterate

quizzes.explanation: Denying or doubting the resurrection after death is kufr according to unanimous scholarly agreement, regardless of the person's age or literacy level. Clear evidence in the Quran and Sunnah establishes the resurrection, and you must explain this to such a person and call them to repent.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Illiterate mother doubts resurrection

quizzes.questionText: Can a mother stop her daughter from observing voluntary fasts due to nutrition concerns?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, parents have the right to prevent their child from observing voluntary acts of worship if they believe it will be harmful or if they have a need that cannot be met otherwise. However, they have no such right regarding obligatory duties.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Mother stopping daughter from voluntary fasting

quizzes.questionText: Is mut'ah (temporary) marriage permissible in Islam?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, mut'ah marriage is haraam. It has been abrogated and it is not permissible to get married in this way according to Sunni Islam. One who engaged in it unknowingly should repent and ask for forgiveness, but can proceed with a proper marriage if both parties are compatible.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Woman with past mut'ah marriage proposal

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to call your friend 'Ya Khaleeli' (O my close friend)?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, there is nothing wrong with calling someone you love for Allah's sake as your khaleel (close friend). Some Sahabah used this word regarding the Prophet. Khillah is the highest form of love and friendship, though you should ensure the friendship is based on what pleases Allah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Calling friend khaleel

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a Muslim to obtain and read the Gospel (Injeel) or Torah?

options.text: No, because the Quran has made us free from any need for them
Yes, all Muslims should read them regularly
Yes, but only the Old Testament
Yes, it's obligatory for scholars

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to obtain previous scriptures because the Quran explains all beneficial content from them and frees us from needing them. These books are also distorted. However, knowledgeable scholars may read them to refute falsehood or show the contradictions in them.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Obtaining previous scriptures

quizzes.questionText: If severe headaches result from fasting, is it permissible to break the fast and take medicine?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, severe headaches are a valid reason to break the fast, especially if fasting makes them worse. You should take medicine and make up the day later. However, if delaying the medicine won't harm you, you should wait until nighttime.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Severe headaches during Ramadan

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to add extra charity to zakaat al-fitr without telling the recipient?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, there is nothing wrong with giving more than one saa' as zakaat al-fitr, with the intention that the extra is charity, even if you don't tell the poor person about it. The obligatory amount is one saa', but adding more is permissible.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Adding extra to zakaat al-fitr

quizzes.questionText: Is zakaah due on money paid as a down payment for a car whose delivery is delayed for over a year?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, there is no zakaah on money paid toward the value of a car even if delivery is delayed. Zakaah is only due on money you possess that has reached nisaab for one full hijri year, whether from salary or other sources.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Zakaah on car down payment

quizzes.questionText: What topics are permissible for men and women to discuss when needed?

options.text: Only what is necessary such as buying/selling, asking scholars, or da'wah
Any topic as long as it's not about religion
Only religious topics and nothing worldly
All topics are permissible without restrictions

quizzes.explanation: Speaking with non-mahram should only be for specific needs like buying/selling, asking scholars about Islamic matters, or da'wah. Conversations must be brief with nothing doubtful in content or manner. Going into unnecessary detail removes barriers and may lead to negative consequences.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Etiquette of men talking to women

quizzes.questionText: What does the name 'Sameer' mean?

options.text: One who talks or chats in the evening or at night
One who is patient and steadfast
One who is generous and giving
One who is strong and brave

quizzes.explanation: Sameer is derived from 'samara' which means to talk or chat in the evening or at night. It is associated with night and day, and can also mean time or age.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Meaning of name Sameer

quizzes.questionText: If your father owns a caf where haraam activities occur (gambling, music videos, smoking), can you eat from this income?

options.text: Yes if he has halal income sources too, but better not to; eat only what you need
No, it is completely forbidden to eat any of it
Yes, there are no restrictions at all
Yes, but only if you work there too

quizzes.explanation: If the father has other halal income or sells permissible things like tea/coffee alongside haraam activities, the wealth is mixed. In that case there is no sin eating from it if you need to, but it's better not to. You should advise him and only take what you need.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Eating from father's caf with haraam activities

quizzes.questionText: Can pregnant and breastfeeding women break the fast in Ramadan without fearing harm?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, it is not permissible for pregnant and breastfeeding women to break the fast unless they fear harm to themselves or their children. The scholars unanimously agreed that the concession is limited to cases where they fear sickness, harm, or hardship if they fast.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Pregnant and breastfeeding breaking fast without fear

quizzes.questionText: Did the Prophet (peace be upon him) fast the entire month of Sha'baan?

options.text: He fasted most of Sha'baan, not the entire month
Yes, he fasted every single day of Sha'baan
No, he never fasted in Sha'baan
He only fasted the first three days of Sha'baan

quizzes.explanation: The correct view is that the Prophet fasted most of Sha'baan, not the entire month. Aisha said he used to fast all of Sha'baan apart from a few days. The Prophet never fasted any month in full apart from Ramadan.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Fasting entire Sha'baan

quizzes.questionText: If you join the imam after he stands up from rukoo' in the last rak'ah, should you join him or wait for another jamaa'ah?

options.text: Join the imam and complete what you missed
Wait for the second jamaa'ah
Pray alone since you missed the rak'ah
Join but make this prayer nafl instead

quizzes.explanation: It is better to join the imam, as the Prophet said 'Whatever you catch up with, pray, and whatever you have missed, make it up.' Even if you only catch the tashahhud, you should join and complete your prayer after the imam says tasleem.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Joining imam in last rak'ah after rukoo'

quizzes.questionText: Is the hadith 'Seek to draw closer to Allah by virtue of my status' authentic?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, this hadith has no basis according to both Ibn Taymiyah and al-Albani. It is not authentic and should not be relied upon.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Seeking closeness to Allah through Prophet's status

quizzes.questionText: If your father mistreats you and your family and doesn't pray, is it permissible to cut him off?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, even if your father mistreats you and doesn't pray, Allah commands you to treat parents well and honor them. You should have compassion, continue good treatment, and pray for his guidance. Turning away from him will make things worse. Be kind like Prophet Ibrahim was with his mushrik father.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Father's harshness and cutting him off

quizzes.questionText: Can the husband of a woman be the wali (guardian) for her daughter born from zina?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, the husband of the mother cannot be wali for the illegitimate daughter because he is not one of her male relatives. Her wali should be the Muslim ruler or Islamic center director. Some scholars give precedence to maternal relatives like the maternal uncle or grandfather.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Wali for daughter born from zina

quizzes.questionText: What does Islam say about honoring the elderly?

options.text: Honoring grey-haired Muslims is part of glorifying Allah
Only family elders need to be honored
Elderly honor depends on their wealth and status
There are no specific teachings about the elderly

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said 'Part of glorifying Allah is honoring the grey-haired Muslim.' Islam commands showing mercy to young ones and respect to old ones. The Muslim society is built on mutual compassion, cooperation, and honoring the elderly, unlike what happens in many non-Muslim societies.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Muslim society and elderly care

quizzes.questionText: What is the correct etiquette when a man must speak to a non-mahram woman?

options.text: Keep it brief, necessary only, avoid softening voice, and lower gaze
Speak freely as long as it's not about romantic topics
Never speak to non-mahram women under any circumstances
Only speak through a third party mediator

quizzes.explanation: Conversation should be limited to what is necessary, avoiding jokes and laughter. Don't soften your voice or use suggestive words. Lower the gaze as much as possible. Avoid embellishing speech with hand movements, poetry, or romantic phrases as these open doors to fitnah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Etiquette of talking to women in various situations

quizzes.questionText: What does it mean to not make Witr 'resemble Maghrib'?

options.text: Do not sit for first tashahhud like in Maghrib
Do not raise hands before Du'a al-Qunoot
Do not pray exactly three rak'ahs
Do not pray Witr at Maghrib time

quizzes.explanation: When the Prophet forbade making Witr resemble Maghrib, he meant not sitting for the first tashahhud in three-rak'ah Witr. You should either give salam after two rak'ahs or not sit after the second rak'ah. Raising hands before Qunoot doesn't make a difference.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Making Witr resemble Maghrib

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a woman to be alone with a male officer in a room at the embassy even if wearing niqab?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, it is not permissible for a man to be alone with a non-mahram woman even if she wears niqab, as the Prophet said 'No man is alone with a woman but the Shaytan is the third one present.' Khalwah is forbidden whether they can be seen or not. She should bring a mahram or righteous woman with her.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Woman alone with officer in room

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on belief in reincarnation (transmigration of souls)?

options.text: It is kufr and disbelief in Allah and His Messengers
It is permissible if you also believe in the Day of Judgment
It is a minor sin that can be forgiven
It is acceptable for those who don't know better

quizzes.explanation: Belief in reincarnation is one of the worst forms of kufr because it is tantamount to disbelief in the Hereafter, Reckoning, Paradise and Hell. It contradicts clear teachings in the Quran and Sunnah about resurrection, and there is scholarly consensus that believers in this are kaafirs.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on belief in reincarnation

quizzes.questionText: If a woman has not made up missed Ramadan fasts from two years ago and is still unable, what should she do?

options.text: Make them up when able; if unable due to ongoing excuse, wait without sin
Feed poor persons instead since too much time has passed
The obligation is dropped after one year
She must fast consecutively without break

quizzes.explanation: If her excuse continues (pregnancy, breastfeeding, illness), there is no sin and she should make up the days when able, even if after the next Ramadan. If the excuse is permanent with no hope of cure, she doesn't make up but feeds one poor person per day. She should repent if the delay was without valid excuse.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Not making up fasts from two years ago

quizzes.questionText: Is Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) the best of all Prophets?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, Prophet Muhammad is the best of all creation. Evidence includes that he was the imam of all Prophets on the night of Mi'raj, he is the leader of mankind on the Day of Resurrection, he will be first to intercede, and he has the position of praise and glory (al-maqaam al-mahmood).

sourceReference.questionTitle: Superiority of Prophet over all creation

quizzes.questionText: If someone must take medicine every 12 hours and fasting lasts 15 hours, can they break their fast?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, if sickness will result from delaying medicine, there is nothing wrong with not fasting and taking the tablet. You should refrain from eating and drinking after taking it, then make up that day later on shorter days. If delaying won't harm you, delay it to nighttime.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Taking medicine every 12 hours in Ramadan

quizzes.questionText: If you have a medical problem causing unpleasant smell from your nose that bothers others, should you stop attending congregational prayers?

options.text: Yes, if you cannot prevent it by perfume or other means
No, you must always attend congregation regardless
Only avoid Jumu'ah, not other prayers
Only avoid if people complain directly

quizzes.explanation: If you fear bothering people and cannot prevent it by perfume or covering your nose, you should stay away from congregational prayers. You have a valid excuse and will receive the reward for praying in congregation even at home. First, continue seeking treatment and don't despair of healing.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Medical problem in nose and congregation

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to pray Witr with nine rak'ahs, two tashahhuds and one salaam?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, this is one of the authentic ways of praying Witr. Aisha narrated that the Prophet prayed nine rak'ahs, sitting only in the eighth for tashahhud without salaam, then praying the ninth and sitting for tashahhud and salaam. However, this is specifically for Witr, not Taraweeh.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Praying Witr with nine rakahs

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to give zakaah to a poor person to help him build a house on land he owns?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, accommodation is a basic need. There is nothing wrong with giving zakaah to someone who owns land but cannot afford to build on it. He comes under the general heading of poor and needy who are among those to whom zakaah may be given, as housing is a necessity that people cannot do without.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Taking zakaah to build house

quizzes.questionText: Is it forbidden to marry someone who is illegitimate?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, none of the reputable fuqaha have stated that marrying an illegitimate person is haraam. If they are Muslim, the marriage is sound, as the sin of their parents does not rest on them. The most honorable before Allah are the most pious, regardless of lineage.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Marrying illegitimate person

quizzes.questionText: Is it sinful to only fast in Ramadan and not observe any voluntary fasts?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: No, it is not a sin. The obligatory fasting is only Ramadan. The Prophet told a man who asked if he had to fast more than Ramadan: 'No, unless you do it voluntarily.' However, voluntary fasts have great reward and make up for any shortfall in obligatory fasts.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Only fasting Ramadan without voluntary fasts

quizzes.questionText: Is it makrooh to name a child 'Momin' (Mu'min - believer)?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, it is makrooh because it involves self-praise and may be used in wrong context. If asked 'Is Momin in the house?' and the answer is no, it sounds like there's no believer in the house. The Prophet forbade names that imply self-praise. You should call him 'Abd al-Mu'min instead if you want this meaning.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Calling child Momin

quizzes.questionText: Does passing wind from the front passage (vagina) break wudoo for women?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: Passing wind from the front passage does not break wudoo. Only passing wind from the back passage breaks wudoo according to Islamic rulings.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Passing wind from the front passage

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a woman to cut her hair short due to medical reasons like excessive hair loss?

options.text: Yes, if it protects her from harm and she doesn't imitate men or disbelievers
No, it is always forbidden for women to cut their hair short
Only if her husband gives permission
Yes, without any conditions

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to cut her hair short for medical reasons as it protects her from harm, but she must not make herself look like men or disbelieving women.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Cutting hair because of sickness

quizzes.questionText: What should a Muslim do when relatives mistreat him or cut him off?

options.text: Uphold ties with them even if they cut him off
Cut ties with them in response to their mistreatment
Only maintain ties if they change their behavior first
Wait for them to apologize before reconnecting

quizzes.explanation: The Muslim should uphold ties with relatives even if they cut him off, treating them well despite their mistreatment. Allah will continue to support the one who maintains family ties. This is supported by the hadith: 'If you are as you say, then it is as if you are putting hot ashes in their mouths. Allah will continue to support you as long as you continue to do that.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Problems with his family because he is depressed

quizzes.questionText: What does the Prophet's hadith 'A woman may be married for four things' primarily encourage men to prioritize?

options.text: Religious commitment
Wealth
Beauty
Noble lineage

quizzes.explanation: The hadith describes what people commonly look for in marriage, but the Prophet explicitly encouraged seeking religious commitment when he said 'Seek the one who is religiously-committed, may your hands be rubbed with dust.' The other qualities are not what the Prophet recommended prioritizing.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Commentary on the hadeeth, 'A woman may be married for four things'

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on someone who claims Buddha was a Prophet?

options.text: They become a disbeliever (kaafir)
It is a minor sin but they remain Muslim
It is permissible as a matter of scholarly difference
They should seek forgiveness but it doesn't affect their faith

quizzes.explanation: Buddha was not a Prophet but a disbelieving philosopher. Believing he was a Prophet is an act of disbelief (kufr) because it contradicts established Islamic beliefs about prophethood and the finality of Prophet Muhammad's message.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Buddha was a kaafir philosopher not a Prophet

quizzes.questionText: What is the correct understanding of the hadith 'Worship at times of turmoil is like hijrah (migration)'?

options.text: To constantly adhere to worship and Sunnah regardless of circumstances
To single out days of widespread sin for extra worship
To only worship during times when others are sinning
To fast specifically on New Year's Eve to counter sin

quizzes.explanation: The hadith encourages constant adherence to the Sunnah and worship in all circumstances, not singling out specific days for extra worship. It means the Muslim should remain a beacon of faith during dark times, maintaining consistent devotion to Allah regardless of what others are doing.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Doing extra acts of worship on occasions when sin is widespread

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on Abd-Allah al-Harari al-Habashi according to the Standing Committee?

options.text: He is a leader of bidah and misguidance
He is a respected scholar of Islam
His teachings are acceptable with minor issues
He represents mainstream Sunni Islam

quizzes.explanation: The Standing Committee classified him as one of the leaders of innovation and misguidance who seeks to destroy the correct Islamic beliefs. Muslims are warned to beware of this misguided group and their heretical thoughts.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Abd-Allah al-Harari al-Habashi

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on opening the Quran randomly to seek guidance for decisions instead of praying Istikhara?

options.text: It is an innovation (bidah) and not permissible
It is a valid alternative to Istikhara prayer
It is recommended for important decisions
It is permissible if done with good intention

quizzes.explanation: Seeking omens from the Mushaf by opening it randomly is an innovation (bidah) that has no basis in Shariah. The proper method for seeking guidance is through salat al-istikhara and consultation (shura), not through randomly opening the Quran.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on seeking auspicious omens from the Mushaf

quizzes.questionText: Will a person be held accountable for thoughts that merely cross their mind?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: Allah does not hold people accountable for thoughts that merely cross their minds, as stated in the hadith. A person is only accountable when they act upon those thoughts or speak about them. This is from Allah's mercy upon His servants.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Will a person be brought to account for whatever crosses his mind

quizzes.questionText: Can the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) hear people's greetings and salutations upon him?

options.text: Allah conveys the salams to him, and angels convey those from afar
No, he cannot hear anything after death
Yes, he directly hears all salutations from everywhere
Only those said at his grave can be heard

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet hears the salam of those who greet him at his grave directly, as Allah has forbidden the earth from consuming the bodies of prophets. For those who are far away, there are angels appointed by Allah to convey the salams to him.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Can the Prophet hear people's salams

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on men wearing gold watches or gold-plated watches?

options.text: Haram (forbidden)
Halal (permissible)
Makruh (disliked)
Permissible if the gold amount is small

quizzes.explanation: It is haram for men to wear gold in any form, including watches, whether solid gold or gold-plated. This is based on authentic hadiths prohibiting gold for men. However, silver is permissible for men.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Men wearing gold watches

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on reading Quran without wudoo?

options.text: Permissible to recite from memory, but not to touch the Mushaf
Completely forbidden in all circumstances
Permissible to both recite and touch the Mushaf
Only permissible during menstruation

quizzes.explanation: One may recite Quran from memory without wudoo according to the majority of scholars, but touching the Mushaf requires wudoo based on the verse 'None shall touch it except the purified.' However, one in a state of major impurity (janabah) should not recite at all.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Reading Quran without wudoo

quizzes.questionText: Is a Muslim obligated to obey their parents if they order them to do something haram?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: There is no obedience to any created being if it involves disobedience to the Creator. However, the Muslim should refuse gently and continue to treat their parents with kindness and respect, as stated in the hadith: 'There is no obedience to any created being if it involves disobedience to the Creator.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Obeying parents in committing sin

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on celebrating the birthday of the Prophet (Mawlid)?

options.text: It is a bidah (innovation) and not permissible
It is a recommended sunnah
It is obligatory for all Muslims
It is permissible as long as no haram acts occur

quizzes.explanation: Celebrating Mawlid is an innovation (bidah) that has no basis in the Quran or Sunnah. Neither the Prophet nor his Companions nor the early generations celebrated it. The Prophet said: 'Whoever innovates something in this matter of ours that is not part of it will have it rejected.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Celebrating the Mawlid

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to perform Hajj on behalf of someone who is still alive but unable to perform it themselves?

options.text: Yes, if they are unable due to old age or chronic illness
No, Hajj can only be performed on behalf of the deceased
Yes, but only if they are poor
No, unless they give written permission

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to perform Hajj on behalf of someone who is alive but unable to do it themselves due to old age or chronic illness that prevents them from traveling. This is supported by the hadith where a woman asked the Prophet about performing Hajj on behalf of her elderly father.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Hajj on behalf of a living person

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum amount of time a traveler must intend to stay in a place to be considered a resident (and thus unable to shorten prayers)?

options.text: Four days or more
Two days or more
Seven days or more
Ten days or more

quizzes.explanation: According to the correct scholarly opinion, if a traveler intends to stay for four days or more, they are no longer considered a traveler and should pray the prayers in full. This is based on the practice of the Companions and the analysis of various scholarly opinions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: When does a traveler become a resident

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a menstruating woman to enter a mosque?

options.text: No, according to the majority of scholars
Yes, without any restrictions
Yes, but only for urgent needs
Yes, as long as she wears hijab

quizzes.explanation: The majority of scholars prohibit a menstruating woman from entering the mosque based on the hadith: 'I do not permit the mosque to one who is menstruating or one who is junub.' However, she may pass through if necessary without staying.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Menstruating woman entering the mosque

quizzes.questionText: Is it obligatory to grow the beard in Islam?

options.text: Yes, it is obligatory (wajib)
No, it is only recommended (mustahabb)
It is permissible to shave or keep it
It depends on local customs

quizzes.explanation: Growing the beard is obligatory according to the majority of scholars based on the Prophet's command: 'Trim the mustache and let the beard grow.' The command indicates obligation unless there is evidence to suggest otherwise.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Growing the beard is obligatory

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on intentionally breaking one's fast during Ramadan without a valid excuse?

options.text: It is a major sin and requires both making up the day and repentance
It only requires making up the day
It requires kaffarah (expiation) only
It is a minor sin that can be forgiven with istighfar

quizzes.explanation: Intentionally breaking the fast in Ramadan without a valid excuse is a major sin. The person must sincerely repent to Allah, make up the missed day, and may need to pay kaffarah depending on how the fast was broken (e.g., through intercourse).

sourceReference.questionTitle: Breaking the fast deliberately

quizzes.questionText: Which of the following breaks the fast?

options.text: Deliberately swallowing food or drink
Using miswak or toothbrush
Tasting food without swallowing
Applying oil to the skin

quizzes.explanation: Things that break the fast include deliberately eating, drinking, sexual intercourse, intentional vomiting, menstruation, and cupping according to some scholars. Using miswak, tasting food without swallowing, and applying oil do not break the fast.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Things that break the fast

quizzes.questionText: Is Zakat obligatory on a house that one lives in?

options.text: False
True

quizzes.explanation: There is no Zakat on a house that one lives in, nor on personal possessions for use such as cars, furniture, or clothing. Zakat is only due on wealth that is growing or intended for trade.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Zakat on property

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum duration of menstruation (haidh) according to Islamic scholars?

options.text: One day and night
Three days
Five days
There is no minimum

quizzes.explanation: According to the majority of scholars, the minimum duration of menstruation is one day and night (24 hours). The maximum is 15 days according to most scholars, and the usual duration is 6-7 days.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Duration of menstruation

quizzes.questionText: At what point in pregnancy does the fetus receive its soul (ruh)?

options.text: After 120 days (4 months)
At conception
After 40 days
At birth

quizzes.explanation: According to the authentic hadith, the soul is breathed into the fetus after 120 days (4 months) of pregnancy. This is based on the hadith describing the stages of fetal development: 40 days as a nutfah, 40 days as an alaqah, 40 days as a mudghah, then the soul is breathed into it.

sourceReference.questionTitle: When is the soul breathed into the fetus

quizzes.questionText: Is abortion permissible in Islam before the soul is breathed into the fetus?

options.text: Scholars differ: some permit it with valid reason before 40 days, others prohibit it entirely
It is always permissible before 120 days
It is completely forbidden at all stages
It is permissible for any reason before 40 days

quizzes.explanation: Scholars have different views on abortion before the soul is breathed in. Some permit it before 40 days if there is a valid reason, while others prohibit it entirely. All agree that after 120 days (when the soul is breathed in), abortion is only permissible if the mother's life is in danger.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on abortion

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use contraception in Islam?

options.text: Yes, with the consent of both spouses and a valid reason
No, it is completely forbidden
Yes, without any conditions
Only permanent contraception is allowed

quizzes.explanation: Temporary contraception is permissible in Islam with mutual consent of both spouses and for valid reasons such as health concerns, spacing children, or financial hardship. This is based on the permissibility of azl (withdrawal) in the time of the Prophet. Permanent sterilization is generally not permitted unless medically necessary.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on contraception

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for men to wear silk?

options.text: No, except for medical necessity like skin conditions
Yes, without any restrictions
Yes, if it's less than 50% silk
Only pure silk is forbidden, not mixed fabrics

quizzes.explanation: Silk is forbidden for men to wear based on authentic hadiths, except in cases of medical necessity such as skin conditions or itching.
