quizzes.questionText: Do righteous deeds like fasting and prayer expiate sins against the rights of other people?

options.text: No, they only expiate sins against Allah's rights
Yes, they expiate all sins including wrongs to others
Only Hajj expiates sins against others
They expiate half of the wrongs to others

quizzes.explanation: Righteous deeds like prayer, fasting, and Hajj only expiate sins related to Allah's rights, not the rights of other people. To expiate sins against people's rights, one must restore those rights and seek their forgiveness. Even martyrdom doesn't expiate debt.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Expiation for Transgression Against Rights of Others

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on eating so much food that it harms a person?

options.text: It is haram (forbidden)
It is halal as long as the food is permissible
It is makruh (disliked) but not forbidden
There is no ruling on this matter

quizzes.explanation: It is haram to eat so much that it harms you, because this is a kind of extravagance and Allah says: 'eat and drink but waste not by extravagance.' The Prophet taught that one-third should be for food, one-third for drink, and one-third for air.

sourceReference.questionTitle: A son argues with his parents about food and prayer

quizzes.questionText: Will the people of Paradise ever be expelled from it according to Islamic belief?

options.text: No, they will abide in Paradise forever
Yes, if Allah wills they could be expelled
Only minor sinners might be expelled
They stay for a limited time only

quizzes.explanation: The people of Paradise will abide therein forever and will never be expelled. Allah says 'a gift without an end' and 'no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they ever be asked to leave it.' The phrase 'except as your Lord wills' refers to time in the grave and resurrection.

sourceReference.questionTitle: The meaning of the verse about dwelling in Paradise

quizzes.questionText: According to Islamic teaching, what is prayer (salah) described as?

options.text: The pillar of the religion
A voluntary act of worship
Secondary to other obligations
Required only on Fridays

quizzes.explanation: Prayer is described as 'the pillar of the religion' and is the first thing a person will be questioned about on the Day of Resurrection. It is the covenant that distinguishes believers from disbelievers.

sourceReference.questionTitle: She wants to be a good Muslim

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on a muezzin receiving a salary from the bayt al-maal (public treasury) for giving the adhan?

options.text: It is permissible, especially if he needs it
It is completely forbidden
It is only allowed for imams, not muezzins
It nullifies the reward completely

quizzes.explanation: Scholars state that if a muezzin is given something from the bayt al-maal to help him, there is nothing wrong with it, as the bayt al-maal serves Muslim interests. Volunteering without payment is better, but receiving help to perform this duty is permissible.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on receiving a salary for giving the adhaan

quizzes.questionText: Did the Prophet (peace be upon him) ever carry a child during prayer?

options.text: Yes, he carried his granddaughter Umamah during prayer
No, this never happened
Only during voluntary prayers
Only when praying alone at home

quizzes.explanation: It is proven in authentic hadith that the Prophet would pray while carrying Umamah, the daughter of Zaynab. When he prostrated he would put her down, and when he stood up he would pick her up. He also prolonged his prostration when his grandson climbed on his back.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Did children climb upon the Prophet during prayer?

quizzes.questionText: If someone misses a prayer due to sleep, what should they do when they wake up?

options.text: Pray it as soon as they remember
Wait until the same prayer time the next day
There is no need to make it up
Only pray extra voluntary prayers instead

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'Whoever forgets a prayer or sleeps and misses it, its expiation is to make it up as soon as he remembers it.' They should pray the same number of rak'ahs as would have been prayed on time.

sourceReference.questionTitle: How should missed prayers be made up?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a woman to be alone with a non-mahram man in an elevator?

options.text: No, it is not permissible
Yes, if it's a public elevator
Yes, if the journey is very short
Yes, if they don't speak to each other

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible for a woman to be alone with a non-mahram man in any situation, including elevators. The Prophet said: 'No man should be alone with a woman unless her mahram is with her.' There is scholarly consensus that such seclusion is forbidden.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Traveling in an elevator alone with a non-mahram

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to perform Hajj or give charity on behalf of someone who died without praying?

options.text: No, it is not permissible
Yes, it is always permissible for deceased relatives
Only charity is permissible, not Hajj
Only Hajj is permissible, not charity

quizzes.explanation: One who does not pray out of negligence is considered a kafir according to the more correct scholarly opinion, based on the Prophet's statement: 'The covenant between us and them is prayer; whoever abandons it is a kafir.' Therefore, Hajj and charity cannot be done on their behalf.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Should she do Hajj for her mother who did not pray?

quizzes.questionText: According to Ahl as-Sunnah, can a person's appointed time of death be changed?

options.text: No, it cannot be brought forward or delayed
Yes, it changes based on one's actions
Only death by killing changes the appointed time
It can be delayed but not brought forward

quizzes.explanation: Allah has decreed the lifespan for each person and when that appointed time comes, it cannot be brought forward or delayed. The one who is killed dies at their decreed time. This is the belief of Ahl as-Sunnah, unlike the Mu'tazilah who wrongly claim otherwise.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ordaining the end of life according to Ahl as-Sunnah

quizzes.questionText: How many times must a vessel be washed if a dog licks it?

options.text: Seven times, the first time with dust
Three times with water
Once with soap
Five times with any cleaning agent

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The purification of the vessel of one of you, if a dog licks it, is to wash it seven times, the first time with dust.' This shows that dog saliva is impure and requires this specific purification.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Plates licked by dogs at university canteen

quizzes.questionText: What is the first food that will be presented to the people of Paradise when they enter?

options.text: The caudate lobe of whale liver
Fresh dates and milk
The meat of birds
Honey and fruits

quizzes.explanation: According to authentic hadith in Sahih Muslim, the first food presented to the people of Paradise will be the caudate lobe of whale liver. After that, they will be served the meat of the 'bull of Paradise,' and their drink will be from the spring of Salsabeel.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Why is liver of fish the first food of the people of Paradise?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a grown man (past puberty) to sleep in the same bed as his mother?

options.text: No, it is not permissible
Yes, there is no restriction with mahrams
Only if there is no other option
It is permissible if they are fully clothed

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet commanded separation of children in their beds at age ten. This applies even more after puberty, including separation between a son and his mother or father. Scholars emphasize this prevents situations that could lead to harm, especially in modern times.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Grown man sleeping in same bed as mother

quizzes.questionText: What is the first thing that happens to the deceased when placed in the grave?

options.text: The squeezing of the grave
The questioning by angels
Immediate judgment
Entering Paradise or Hell

quizzes.explanation: The squeezing of the grave is the first thing that happens to the deceased when placed in the grave. The Prophet said: 'If anyone were to be spared the squeezing of the grave, Sa'd ibn Mu'adh would have been spared it.' This indicates no one is exempt.

sourceReference.questionTitle: What is the situation in the grave of a child?

quizzes.questionText: According to hadith, how many from Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) will there be compared to believers?

options.text: One thousand from Ya'juj and Ma'juj for every one believer
One hundred from Ya'juj and Ma'juj for every one believer
Five hundred from Ya'juj and Ma'juj for every one believer
Equal numbers of believers and Ya'juj and Ma'juj

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'From every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine' will be sent to Hell. He then explained: 'Be of good cheer, for there will be one man from among you and one thousand from among Ya'juj and Ma'juj.' This shows the vast numbers of these people.

sourceReference.questionTitle: The ratio of people of Paradise to people of Hell

quizzes.questionText: What is the primary obligation that distinguishes a Muslim woman from others in the workplace?

options.text: Wearing hijab and maintaining Islamic conduct
Working only part-time
Avoiding all male colleagues
Never leaving home for work

quizzes.explanation: A Muslim woman must maintain her Islamic identity through proper hijab and Islamic conduct, avoiding situations that lead to fitnah while fulfilling her obligations. Islam allows women to work within the bounds of Shariah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Working in mixed environment and worrying about fast

quizzes.questionText: Does looking at forbidden things invalidate one's fast?

options.text: No, but it decreases the reward of fasting
Yes, it completely invalidates the fast
It invalidates the fast only if done intentionally
It has no effect on the fast at all

quizzes.explanation: Looking at forbidden things does not invalidate the fast itself, but it decreases its reward and may lead to losing the spiritual benefits of fasting. The Prophet said: 'Whoever does not give up false speech and acting upon it, Allah has no need of his giving up food and drink.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Working in mixed environment and worrying about fast

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on a Muslim owning or operating a business that sells alcohol?

options.text: It is completely forbidden (haram)
It is permissible if one doesn't drink it
It is makruh but not forbidden
It is permissible in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Selling, transporting, or dealing with alcohol in any way is completely forbidden. The Prophet cursed ten categories of people related to alcohol, including the one who sells it and benefits from its price, regardless of location.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Business involving alcohol

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum amount of gold (nisab) upon which Zakat becomes obligatory?

options.text: 85 grams of gold
50 grams of gold
100 grams of gold
200 grams of gold

quizzes.explanation: The nisab for gold is 85 grams (approximately 20 mithqals), and Zakat is due at 2.5% if this amount is possessed for one lunar year. This is based on authentic hadiths regarding Zakat on wealth.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Nisab of gold for Zakat

quizzes.questionText: Is a woman allowed to refuse her husband's request for intimacy without valid reason?

options.text: No, it is not permissible without valid excuse
Yes, she has complete freedom to refuse
Only if she is tired from work
She can refuse once per month

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'If a man calls his wife to his bed and she refuses, and he spends the night angry with her, the angels curse her until morning.' However, valid excuses like menstruation, illness, or obligatory fasting are exceptions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Wife refusing husband's call to bed

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on music and musical instruments in Islam according to the majority of scholars?

options.text: Haram (forbidden)
Halal without any restrictions
Permissible on special occasions only
Allowed if it doesn't contain sinful lyrics

quizzes.explanation: The majority of scholars consider music with musical instruments as haram based on various hadiths. Some scholars permit Islamic nasheeds without instruments. The duff (hand drum) is permitted on specific occasions like Eid and weddings.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on music and singing

quizzes.questionText: When should a Muslim begin teaching their child to pray?

options.text: At seven years old
At ten years old
At puberty
When the child can speak

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'Teach your children to pray when they are seven years old, and smack them if they do not pray when they are ten years old, and separate them in their beds.' Teaching begins at seven, with discipline starting at ten.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Teaching children to pray

quizzes.questionText: What invalidates wudu (ablution)?

options.text: Passing wind, using the toilet, or deep sleep
Only using the toilet
Eating and drinking
Speaking during prayer only

quizzes.explanation: Things that invalidate wudu include: anything that comes out from the front or back passage, passing wind, deep sleep while not sitting firmly, loss of consciousness, and touching private parts with desire. Light sleep while sitting does not break wudu.

sourceReference.questionTitle: What invalidates wudu

quizzes.questionText: Is Zakat obligatory on all Muslims?

options.text: False - only on those who possess the nisab
True - on all Muslims without exception

quizzes.explanation: Zakat is obligatory only on Muslims who possess wealth that reaches the nisab (minimum threshold) and has been in their possession for one lunar year. It is one of the five pillars of Islam but has specific conditions for obligation.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Conditions for Zakat to be obligatory

quizzes.questionText: Can a woman lead men in prayer?

options.text: No, she cannot lead men in prayer
Yes, if she is knowledgeable
Only in her home
Only during voluntary prayers

quizzes.explanation: A woman cannot lead men in prayer according to scholarly consensus. The Prophet said: 'A people who appoint a woman as their leader will never prosper.' Women may lead other women in prayer, standing in the middle of the row.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Women leading prayer

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to shake hands with a non-mahram member of the opposite gender?

options.text: No, it is forbidden
Yes, if done respectfully
Yes, in professional settings
Only if wearing gloves

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'It is better for one of you to be stabbed in the head with an iron needle than to touch a woman who is not permissible for him.' Physical contact with non-mahram is forbidden to prevent fitnah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Shaking hands with opposite gender

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum duration of menstruation (hayd) according to most scholars?

options.text: One day and night
Three days
Five days
Seven days

quizzes.explanation: The minimum period for menstruation is one day and night according to most scholars, while the maximum is 15 days. Anything outside these limits is considered istihaadah (irregular bleeding), which has different rulings.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Minimum and maximum of menstruation

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to offer voluntary prayers during the prohibited times?

options.text: No, except prayers with specific reasons
Yes, all voluntary prayers are always allowed
Only Qiyam al-Layl is forbidden
There are no prohibited times

quizzes.explanation: There are three prohibited times for voluntary prayer: after Fajr until sunrise, when the sun is at its zenith, and after Asr until sunset. Exceptions include prayers with specific causes like Tahiyat al-Masjid or making up missed Sunnah prayers.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Prohibited times for prayer

quizzes.questionText: Can a woman travel for Hajj without a mahram?

options.text: No, she must have a mahram with her
Yes, if traveling with a group of women
Yes, if the journey is safe
Only elderly women need a mahram

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said: 'A woman should not travel except with a mahram.' This applies to Hajj and all travel. Having a mahram is a condition for Hajj obligation for women. A group of women or a 'safe group' does not replace this requirement.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Woman traveling for Hajj without mahram

quizzes.questionText: Is it obligatory to pray Taraweeh during Ramadan?

options.text: False - it is Sunnah, not obligatory
True - it is obligatory like the five daily prayers

quizzes.explanation: Taraweeh is a confirmed Sunnah (Sunnah mu'akkadah), not obligatory. The Prophet prayed it but stopped leading it publicly for fear it might become obligatory on the ummah. One who prays it with faith and seeking reward will have past sins forgiven.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Ruling on Taraweeh prayer

quizzes.questionText: What is the punishment for theft (cutting off the hand) applicable to?

options.text: Stealing a nisab amount or more from a secure place
Any theft regardless of amount
Only stealing from mosques
Stealing from family members

quizzes.explanation: Hadd punishment for theft requires specific conditions: stealing nisab amount (1/4 dinar of gold or equivalent), from a secure place (hirz), without doubt or ambiguity. Theft from family or during famine may not meet these conditions.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Conditions for hadd of theft

quizzes.questionText: Can a Muslim celebrate non-Islamic religious holidays?

options.text: No, it is not permissible
Yes, if done out of respect
Only cultural aspects are permissible
Yes, if living in a non-Muslim country

quizzes.explanation: Muslims are not allowed to celebrate or participate in non-Islamic religious festivals like Christmas or Diwali. The Prophet said: 'Whoever imitates a people is one of them.' Muslims have only two Eids: Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Celebrating non-Islamic festivals

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum number of witnesses required to prove zina (adultery/fornication) for hadd punishment?

options.text: Four adult male witnesses
Two adult witnesses
Three witnesses
One witness and an oath

quizzes.explanation: Zina requires four adult, trustworthy male witnesses who saw the act itself clearly, or confession. This strict requirement protects people's honor. If fewer than four witnesses come forward, they are punished for slander (qadhf) with 80 lashes.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Proof required for zina

quizzes.questionText: Is it recommended (mustahabb) to send blessings upon the Prophet after the iqaamah?

options.text: Yes, it is mustahabb according to the majority of scholars
No, it is forbidden after iqaamah
It is only done after adhan, not iqaamah
It is obligatory, not just recommended

quizzes.explanation: The majority of scholars (Hanafis, Shafi'is, and Hanbalis) hold that it is mustahabb (recommended) to send blessings upon the Prophet after the iqaamah, just as after the adhan, and to repeat after the one saying the iqaamah.

sourceReference.questionTitle: Sending blessings upon the Prophet after the iqaamah

quizzes.questionText: If a child's parents have different religions (one Muslim, one non-Muslim), which religion does the child follow?

options.text: The child follows the religion of the Muslim parent
The child follows the father's religion only
The child chooses when reaching puberty
The child is considered non-Muslim until conversion

quizzes.explanation: According to the majority of scholars including Abu Hanifah, ash-Shafi'i, and Ahmad, if a child's parents have different religions, the child follows whichever parent is Muslim, whether it is the father or the mother. Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah confirmed this consensus.

sourceReference.questionTitle: A small child follows the religion of whichever parent is Muslim

quizzes.questionText: Are the jinn accountable for their actions like human beings?

options.text: True
False

quizzes.explanation: Yes, the jinn are part of Allah's creation and are His slaves who are accountable and subject to commands and prohibitions, just like human beings. Allah says: 'And I created not the jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me.' There are believers and disbelievers among them.

sourceReference.questionTitle: The Jinn

quizzes.questionText: Where is it better for a woman to pray: in the mosque or in her house?

options.text: In her house
In the mosque
Both are equal in reward
In the courtyard of the mosque

quizzes.explanation: While it is permissible for a woman to pray in the mosque, praying in her house is better for her. The Prophet told Umm Humayd: 'I know that you love to pray with me, but praying in your house is better for you than praying in your courtyard.'

sourceReference.questionTitle: Is it permissible for a woman to pray outside the mosque where men can see her?
